plugins.name: Select Similar

‚Äì Relative Layer Position.

‚Äì Font Name, Size, Weight.

‚Äì Fill.

‚Äì Stroke Color, Weight.

‚Äì Size Width, Height.

‚Äì Locked.

‚Äì Text Content.

‚Äì Missing Fonts.

‚Äì Multiple Fonts.

Order of actions:

- Select the sample layer (multiple layers are possible).

114275.release_notes:
Select Similar updated! üöÄ
Happy 2025 :)

1. Added support for dark theme! Switches together with the Figma theme.
2. Added new search terms!
2.1 You can search separately by width and height.
2.2. You can search separately by font name, size and weight.
2.3. You can search separately by stroke color and weight.
3. Added support for asynchronous page loading - now the plugin should run faster in large files.
4. Configured networkAccess. The plugin does not make any requests.
5. Improved the search for texts with multiple fonts: now only font names are compared, and the weight is ignored.
6. Made changes to the plugin architecture.
7. Updated ways to say thanks.

plugins.name: data.to.design ‚Äî by ‚Äπdiv‚Ä∫RIOTS ‚Äî Google Sheets, CSV, JSON, Airtable or Notion to Figma
plugins.description:
Fill your Figma designs with your data

With data.to.design, import your product content into Figma and populate your designs with real data. Create more accurate and realistic prototypes with less bias, bringing your designs closer to what‚Äôs in production.


data.to.design makes it easy to automatically populate cards, profiles pages, table data and other repeatable UI elements with a single click.


Top features include:


Import your own, existing content

With data.to.design, import your existing data from sources such as Google Sheets, JSON, Airtable, Notion, CSV, or even directly from your API.

Keep your designs in sync by easily refreshing the data whenever changes occur.


Apply your data to any Figma layer

With data.to.design, easily insert real content into your designs to make your designs more realistic.


Map data to component instances automatically

Select layers on your design, hover over the data.to.design plugin and simply apply the content you need to your designs.

Configure once, and apply everywhere using our mapping feature, which automatically applies content to the selected instances of a given component. Save time and gain consistency throughout your designs.


Try data.to.design to level-up your Figma designs with your real data and content!


Ideas, feedback, questions?

Drop us an email or follow us on Discord.

plugins.name: OlivePress - Image Compression and Export (JPEG, PNG, WebP and SVG)
plugins.description:
Olive Press is an image compression and exporting tool for Figma. It allows you to export already compressed images directly from Figma. Olive Press supports the compression, conversion, and export of JPEG, PNG, WEBP, and SVG images.


Usage

  1. Open Olive Press - Image Compression
  2. Select the layer(s) you'd like to export
  3. Select the desired image format from the dropdown
  4. Click the + icon to add the layers
  5. Adjust the file name, suffix, and scale
  6. Click Compress
  7. Download the compressed files


Support

For support, please email work@alexjvale.com.


¬© 2024 All rights reserved.
plugins.tagline: Compress and export JPEG, PNG, WebP, and SVG.

plugins.name: Text Fill
plugins.description:
Steps to use:

  • Select the text you want to use as a fill
  • Hold down Shift and select the shape you want to fill
  • Press the ‚ÄúCreate‚Äù button


note: the plugin won‚Äôt run if you hit the Enter or Return key on your keyboard


For the best results:

  • You only select 1 text node and 1 shape before running the plugin
  • You use 1 line of text
  • You use a closed shape, i.e. you shouldn‚Äôt use a line as your shape
  • If you use a vector network as your shape, make sure it has a fill before you run the plugin

plugins.name: Design System Hub
plugins.description:
Collects UX Design Systems from all over the world


Here you can easily find the relevant information you need, including the official website of the design system and its component library files in Figma.


Design System Hub is a collection of design systems for your projects.

Curated global UX design systems and Figma libraries, offering tools, resources, and inspiration to streamline your design workflow.


Design System Hub brings together UX design systems from around the world, making it simple for designers to find and use resources for both inspiration and practical projects. The plugin offers direct links to official design system websites and their component libraries in Figma, helping teams work more efficiently while keeping their designs consistent and organized.


Alongside the curated design systems, the plugin includes a wide range of tools and resources that designers can use to enhance their workflow. You‚Äôll find font previews, color tools, vector logos, 3D assets, table generators, and accessibility checkers, as well as creative inspiration tools like UI Faces, motion effects, wave generators, and prototyping kits.

plugins.name: Quick Material Icons
plugins.description:
The fastest way to insert font based material design icons.


Quick Material Icons is optimized for speed of use. The gist: run the plugin, search for an icon and add it to your file. But the details make this experience feel great.


I highly recommend adding a shortcut to the plugin. (see below for instructions)


Usage

  • CMD+P, then type "icon", enter. Or setup a shortcut (instructions below)
  • You'll see a list of icons. After choosing your first, you'll see a list of recent icons
  • When you type, the full icon list is filtered and sorted based on recency.
  • Click or press Enter to select the icon. (you can also use arrow keys).


Features

  • Recent icons show by default.
  • Select with your keyboard.
  • After searching, results are sorted by recency.
  • When a text object is selected, and it has the same name as an icon, the plugin will automatically replace the text for that icon. Eg. a text object using Helvetica has close as characters. Running the plugin will use the Material Icons font and show an icon instead.
  • Running the plugin without a selection will add an icon in the center of the viewport.
  • If multiple text elements are selected, the plugin will run for each element.
  • If a frame or group is selected, the icon will be added to the center of the object.


How to set a shortcut to run the plugin (mac)

  • Go to System Preferences > Keyboard > Shortcuts
  • Select App Shortcuts from the left sidebar
  • Click the [+] button
  • Choose Figma from the Applications dropdown
  • In Menu Title type Quick Material icons
  • In Keyboard Shortcut, type whatever works best for you. I recommend ctrl + l

plugins.name: Simple Table Generator
plugins.description:
Table Generator
This plugin generate tables with information from Excel/Google Sheet.

---
Instructions

Step 1:
Copy by using Command/Ctrl + C to select the area you would like to be used as the
source data from your spreadsheet.

Step 2:
Paste your content into the first input box.

Step 3:
Select the width of your table. Please note this plugin will match the number of columns you
have in your original data and equally place them in the width selected.

Step 4:
Customize your font colour, font size, font family, letter spacing and line height if necessary.

Step 5:
Select (Yes/No) if you have included a header in the first row.

Step 6:
Click button to generate table.

---
Additional Information
This plugin do not read .csv file. Please copy and paste your data in.

All the text are left aligned. 

A line will be generated at the bottom of each row. If you select to indicate header is included
in the first row. The first row will not have line under it. Lines generated have the same
colour as text.

---
Get in touch:
This project started as my current workplace needed something like this. This eliminates any stress 
of manually adding information into Figma. We want this to be available to the community. So
if you have any feedback on how to make this plug in better, please shoot me an email 
chao@reflektor.digital

---
Souce Code: 
If you are interested, the source code of this plugin is available at 
https://bitbucket.org/reflektor-digital/figma-simple-table-plugin/src/master/

plugins.name: LilGrid
plugins.description:
LilGrid takes elements and arranges them into a grid automatically.


Select elements to organize, or leave nothing selected to let it organize everything on your page. It only affects top-level elements on your page.


For example it‚Äôs great to use on pages full of icons for your design system.


Just adjust the number of columns and the spacing you want between them. The spacing is based on the size of the grid. At the 1x default a set of 24px icons will have 24px spacing. 0.5x will be 12px and so on.


Optionally turn on Sorting to also alphabetize while organizing them.


It also now saves your last configuration, so if you have your preference for grids it's essentially a single-click tool.


That‚Äôs all it does. It‚Äôs non-destructive, it only changes positioning of elements, and it‚Äôs a one-step undo if you need to.

accepted.name: Wayne Sang
accepted.description: Design and Product person

plugins.tagline: It does one thing: Organize layers into a grid. Fast, easy, no added containers.

plugins.name: Figma to Bravo Studio -> Design & build native apps
plugins.description:
Our Figma plugin will speed up your app's tagging process by selecting one or multiple tags that you want to add to a page, frame, or component. Additionally, the plugin will help you to validate whether or not your Figma file is ready to be imported into Bravo Studio.


üëè What is Bravo Studio?

Bravo Studio allows you to use your design as a UI for your backend creating a production capable prototype. Unlike other app builders, Bravo leverages the design and data handling of third-party tools, adding flexibility to the process, while keeping the design in sync with your Bravo app so you can iterate super fast. Mobile specific functionality (like login) can be added by connecting data with the UI elements using Bravo Tags - annotations placed on the layer names of your design file- which Bravo then converts into native components (both iOS and Android). We call this process ‚ÄúBravorizing your design‚Äù.


üé® What is Bravorizing?

Bravorizing is the process of setting up your design file to then be converted into a native app by Bravo Studio.

In general, Bravorizing consists of:

  • Structuring layers as required by each Bravo component
  • Adding Bravo tags to add functionality and structure

Learn how to bravorize with this intro video and check out the different setup steps below. You can also duplicate a sample design file that is already Bravorized to learn about its setup.


üîå How to use the plugin

  1. Open the plugin.
  2. Select a layer.
  3. Then go to the Bravo tagger tab and select the tag(s) you want to add to the layer.
  4. After that, go to the Tag checker to validate your Bravorized design.
  5. Finally, when there are no issues, you are ready to import the file to Bravo Studio.



Resources

  • üéì Learn more from our Help Center
  • üé• Subscribe to our Youtube channel
  • üëã Join the Bravo community


We want to improve with your Feedback!

Ôªø

If you have any questions or issues, don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out to us at support@bravostudio.app
plugins.tagline: Add your ready-to-use Bravo UI presets!

plugins.name: Iconhub
plugins.description:
IconHub is a very useful plugin for designers who use the Figma application in their work. Developed by Javan Cipta Solusi and One Week Wonders, IconHub allows users to easily search, select and organize the required icons in their designs. This plugin has a wide and varied collection of icons, which can be used for many types of design projects.


One of IconHub's main features is the ability to search for icons by keyword, making it easier for users to find the icon that fits their needs. Apart from that, users can also save their favorite icons and organize their own icon collection. This is especially useful in jobs that require consistent use of icons.


One of IconHub's main features is the ability to search for icons by keyword, making it easier for users to find the icon that fits their needs. plugins.name: FlyOver
plugins.description:
Fly through your Figma or FigJam file with smooth animations, helpful for presentations and bookmarking views


-----


Free version

  • 1 presentation with 20 views


Pro version

  • Unlimited presentations
  • Unlimited views
  • Customize the animation speed, style and easing for each view
  • Pay once, use forever


-----


Adding views

  • Add views from your current location on the page
  • Add views connected to the elements on the page
  • You can add multiple connected views at once
  • You can also add multiple elements in one connected view as a group


Updating views

  • Easily update, sort and delete views
  • Double click to rename
  • Auto deletes views connected to elements when they are deleted from the page


Presentation

  • Click on your views to animate to the corresponding location and zoom level
  • Navigate using the arrow buttons or keyboard keys
  • Toggle between regular and compact mode
  • Share your screen with your teammates or ask them to observe you in your file to follow your presentation

plugins.name: Typist - animated typing text for forms and chat UI
plugins.description:
Typist helps make your prototypes look so so real by turning text layers into animated, typing text components. No more super-fake janky forms! Bring that chat interface you're working on to life!


What Typist does


Typist generates components for you from text layers in your Figma file. These can help dial up the realism on your presentations and can be indispensable for stress-testing text-based chat UI. The components that Typist generates are animated based on your preferences, and all you have to do is drop them into your prototype to get some of your very own RAD TEXT TYPING ACTION.


How to use Typist


  1. Select one or more text layers in your Figma file and run the plugin.
  2. Specify how you want the typing animation to look.
  3. Hit the "Create component" button to generate components from your selected text layers.
  4. Use those components as you wish in your prototypes.


Typist tips n' tricks


First of all, Typist respects your text layers' width settings. If you create a component from a text layer set to Auto Width, the component will resize horizontally. If you create one from a text layer set to Auto Height, it'll resize vertically.

  • Auto width text fields are better for single line forms, cause you can put them into an Auto Layout with a cursor gif and it looks cool
  • Auto height text fields are better for multiple-turn chat animations that build up vertically, because you can wrap the whole thing in an Auto Layout and it'll manage it's own height
  • Examples of both of these most common use cases are in the Playground file, pls enjoy


The "Type by" setting tells Typist whether you want to animate individual letters, words, or chunks of text. It's basically the first of two speed controls.

  • The default setting, Type by Word, works pretty well for a paragraph or two of text, like you might see as a response when you're chatting with an AI.
  • If you want to simulate form input or a single line of text, Type by Letter will get you there.
  • If you have a TON of text you can try Type by Multiple Words so you're not waiting around all day.


The "Speed" setting controls the timing between animation steps.


And "Randomness" will apply a little staggery swagger to the generated component. It's less noticeable at faster speed values.


Enjoy!


~ Jay
plugins.tagline: Generate animated typing components from any text layer.

  • Auto height text fields are better for multiple-turn chat animations that build up vertically, because you can wrap the whole thing in an Auto Layout and it'll manage it's own height
  • Examples of both of these most common use cases are in the Playground file, pls enjoy


The "Type by" setting tells Typist whether you want to animate individual letters, words, or chunks of text. It's basically the first of two speed controls.

  • The default setting, Type by Word, works pretty well for a paragraph or two of text, like you might see as a response when you're chatting with an AI.
  • If you want to simulate form input or a single line of text, Type by Letter will get you there.
  • If you have a TON of text you can try Type by Multiple Words so you're not waiting around all day.


The "Speed" setting controls the timing between animation steps.


And "Randomness" will apply a little staggery swagger to the generated component. It's less noticeable at faster speed values.


Enjoy!


~ Jay
74715.tagline: Generate animated typing components from any text layer.

plugins.name: Upspeed - Convert Figma to Android
plugins.description:
Figma to mobile code in one click.


Spending too much time building UI ? Having a hard time reducing the inconsistency between design and development ? Don't have time to get up to speed with Jetpack Compose ? Upspeed's Figma plugin can help you quickly translate your Figma UI elements to secure, production ready code.


What sets us apart is that the code we generate is as if you have another developer working with you. Upspeed uses the right UI constructs based on characteristics of the UI element, relationship with elements around it and generates secure, optimized code that can be imported into your application. Since you control the code, make any additional modifications as needed.


Our mission is to help individuals and teams build faster and use their valuable time creating unique value instead.


How does it work?

  1. Install the Plugin
  2. Open your Figma file. Right click on the workspace, and choose Upspeed from your list of plugins
  3. Select the component or screen you want to translate
  4. Update the type of element from our dropdown list
  5. Click 'Generate'
  6. 'Copy to Clipboard' to copy the code into your IDE


Best practices

Figma components enable you to create elements you can reuse across your designs. They help to create and manage consistent design across your project. Use Upspeed's Figma plugin to select and translate those reusable elements that can be used to build your UI quickly and in a consistent manner.


Questions?

We value your feedback! Let us know what else you would like to see in this application. Email us at support@upspeed.io or submit your feedback here.


Check out our Help Center to get started. Report an issue here.

plugins.name: ÈÄèËßÜÂèòÊç¢ Perspective Transform
plugins.description:
Plugin Description:

The "Perspective Transform" plugin for Figma allows you to easily apply perspective and skew transformations to text and shape layers. This tool provides a visual interface with sliders to adjust the horizontal and vertical skew angles, enabling you to create dynamic and visually interesting designs. Additionally, it supports multiple languages, including Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, English, Hindi, Japanese, and Korean. You can reset transformations to their original state with a single click, ensuring precise control over your design elements.


Function Introduction:

  1. Perspective Transformations: Easily apply horizontal and vertical skew transformations to selected text or shape layers using intuitive sliders.
  2. Multi-language Support: The plugin interface supports multiple languages, including Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, English, Hindi, Japanese, and Korean. Language selection can be changed from the dropdown menu.
  3. Real-time Preview: Adjust the sliders and see real-time updates on your design elements, allowing for precise adjustments and creativity.
  4. Reset Transformations: Quickly reset transformations to their original state with the reset button, ensuring you can always return to the starting point if needed.
  5. Consistency Check: When selecting multiple elements, the plugin checks for consistency in skew angles, ensuring uniform transformations across all selected elements. If angles are inconsistent, a notification will prompt you.

plugins.description:
Ditto manages your product text ‚Äî from draft to design to development.

Eliminate the copy and paste and let everyone on your team (from designers and writers to product and engineering) work from a single source of truth.


Ditto is infrastructure for your team‚Äôs product text.

  1. üåê Keep copy in sync across content, design, and development
  2. üìö Build and manage a library of reusable text components
  3. üö¶ Review text and track changes across stakeholders ‚Äî assign owners, suggest edits, set statuses, all with a running edit history
  4. üíª Pull up-to-date text directly into development ‚Äî for web, iOS, Android, and more
  5. ü§ñ Integrate Figma files with your existing localization or A/B testing tools
  6. üí™ Manage real, complex product text with support for plurals, dynamic values / variables, and variations


Getting Started

To get started, open this plugin in any Figma file! (Or, just click ‚ÄúTry it out‚Äù)

  1. üìñ Have questions? Check out our help guides.
  2. üôãüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Need a hand? Contact support.
  3. üëã Join our community on Twitter or LinkedIn.
  4. üóû We ship weekly and are always looking to improve! Check out the latest at What‚Äôs New.

plugins.name: Auto Responsive
plugins.description:
This plugin analyzes any design to understand its children‚Äôs arrangement. It then automatically deduces the dominant direction and alignment to apply auto-layout accordingly. The algorithm automatically runs this process recursively until the design and all its children containers become responsive. As a result, you can resize the design and see how it responds smartly to growing and shrinking content.

 

To tweak the results, you can undo (Cmd+Z) all changes and make smaller layers responsive rather than fixing the whole design at once.


Resources:

  • Tutorial file: http://bit.ly/auto-responsive-figma
  • Video demo: http://bit.ly/auto-responsive-demo

plugins.name: Simple Sort
plugins.description:
Automatically applies a basic structure to your component sets (variants) which can be customised to your liking.


---


Manual Mode


Rows & Columns

Decide whether the variants for a particular property should be arranged horizontally or vertically.


Order of values

You can rearrange each of the values for a particular property within the row or column.


Order of properties

Unfortunately this still has to be done in Figma. If you'd like to change the order of properties do so in Figma's right-hand side panel when a component set is selected. You'll need to re-rerun the plugin (or at least deselect and re-select the component set) to see the changes.



Auto Mode


The intended use of auto is to reapply the last applied settings without opening the plugin UI.


If the plugin has not been run on a particular component set yet then the most basic settings (first property in rows, all others in columns) will be applied.


---


Known issues:


  • I can't handle the maths for rotated objects, so I just reset rotation to 0. If this is a problem for anyone please let me know.

accepted.name: James Mitchell
accepted.description: Product Designer at Frontify

plugins.tagline: An easy way to sort your variants

plugins.name: TextCutter
plugins.description:
TextCutter is a lightweight plugin for Figma to split or join text layers. There is no UI, and it's focused on speed of interaction.


There are four commands in the plugin, the core command ‚ÄúSplit text‚Äù, and three additional commands: Join text, Split words and Remove bullets.


How to use


Split text

  1. Select a text layer with multiple lines of text
  2. Run the plugin
  3. Your results (new layers) will appear on your current page in the same spot


Join text

  1. Select multiple text layers
  2. Run the plugin
  3. Your results (a merged layer) will appear on the page in the same spot


Split words

  1. Select a text layer with multiple words
  2. Run the "Split words" command
  3. Your results (new layers for each word) will appear on your current page in the same spot


Remove bullets

  1. Select one or multiple text layers containing bullet-like characters (such as ‚Ä¢)
  2. Run the "Remove bullets" command
  3. The bullets will be removed from the text


A tip


You can use this plugin along with OCR software that helps extract texts from images based on a screenshot, such as TextSniper or Cleanshot for Mac.

accepted.name: Obra Studio
accepted.description: Obra Studio helps software companies get to the next design level

accepted.name: Vadim Pleshkov
accepted.description: Product Designer

plugins.tagline: Split or join text layers with a simple command.

plugins.name: PowerPoint Importer
plugins.description:
‚ú® Import PowerPoint files into Figma, FigJam & Figma Slides ‚ú®

Import your PowerPoint slides (.pptx) directly into Figma with full editing capabilities.


üß© Features:

  1. Convert and fully edit your PowerPoint files in Figma‚Äîno need to recreate from scratch.
  2. Maintains original colors, text sizes, font families, and weights from PowerPoint.
  3. No monthly subscriptions‚Äîjust pay for what you use, when you use it.
  4. No registration required.


‚ùìFrequently asked questions:

What are import credits?

Import credits are units that users can purchase to import PowerPoint files. Each file consumes a certain number of credits based on the number of slides in the presentation.


How are import credits calculated?

Import credits are calculated based on the number of slides in the PowerPoint file you want to import. Each slide consumes 1 credit.


Can I purchase multiple packages at the same time?

Yes, you can buy import credits in packages that suit your needs. We offer different options to accommodate various usage levels. You can find all available packages here.


How do I know how many import credits I need?

When you upload your PowerPoint file, we'll automatically calculate the required import credits. You'll see this information before proceeding in the plugin‚Äôs UI.


What happens if I don't have enough credits?

If you attempt to import a PowerPoint file but you don't have enough credits, we will notify you to purchase additional credits in the plugin‚Äôs UI.


Are there any limitations on file size or number of imports?

The maximum file size allowed is 100 MB and there's no limit on the number of imports you can perform as long as you have sufficient credits.


Is there an expiry date or time limit on credits?

No, there is no expiry date or time limit on credits. You can use them whenever you need to import files without worrying about expiration.


Can I try the plugin for free?

Yes, we offer 1 free trial so you can try the plugin risk-free.


üì© Feedback and support:

Your feedback is important to us! For comments, inquiries or assistance, please reach out to us at support@figmats.com


üí≠ Contact us:

Join our community for the latest updates, practical tutorial, future announcements and daily inspiration.

plugins.name: PixelsConvert
plugins.description:
Get dimensions of layers in different units!

Now you can get dimensions based on the different screen density (in dpi).

Select any one of the six screen densities available-

  • ldpi
  • mdpi
  • hdpi
  • xhdpi
  • xxhdpi
  • xxxhdpi


And get dimensions in five different units as follows -

  • px (pixels)
  • dp or dip (density independent pixels)
  • pt (points)
  • mm (millimeters)
  • in (inches).



Let me hear your feedback/suggestions in comments below or at galwhodesigns@gmail.com
